content: double_crochet *^ch1 skip next double_crochet puff in next single_crochet chain 1 skip next double_crochet ^ bpsc in next 3 double_crochet * round 11 with same yarn ch2 counts as fi rst half_double_crochet or with repeat from * to * 10 times and from ^ to ^ once slip_stitch to new yarn standing half_double_crochet in joining st half_double_crochet in each stitches and fi rst bpsc to join do not fasten_off ch1 space to corner 11 half_double_crochet in all *work half_double_crochet ch2 half_double_crochet in 36 bpsc 24 ch1 spaces 12 puff stitches ch3 corner space half_double_crochet in next 33 stitches and ch1 spaces * repeat from * to * two times more half_double_crochet in last 21 stitches note you may notice your work tends to ruffl e after round and ch1 spaces slip_stitch to fi rst half_double_crochet to join 6 and will continue to ruffl e for the next few rounds but it 140 half_double_crochet 4 ch2 spaces should work itself out by the end round 12 with same yarn ch3 or with new yarn standing note skipping ch1 spaces again double_crochet in joining st double_crochet in each st across to corner 2dc ch2 round 7 ch1 single_crochet in same bpsc as connecting slip_stitch from r6 single_crochet 2dc in corner ch2 space skip fi rst st on next side 4 times double_crochet in next two bpsc 5dc in eye of next puff single_crochet in next in each remaining st to fi rst st slip_stitch to fi rst double_crochet to join fasten three bpsc 11 times 5dc in eye of last puff slip_stitch to off fi rst single_crochet to join and fasten_off 152 double_crochet 38 per side 4 ch2 space 60 double_crochet 36sc weave in all ends round 8 with new yarn standing bpsc in second double_crochet of any 5dc group bpsc in next two double_crochet *^skip next double_crochet and single_crochet treble_crochet ch1 4 times treble_crochet in next single_crochet skip next single_crochet and double_crochet bpsc in next 3 double_crochet ch1 skip next double_crochet and single_crochet v_stitch in next single_crochet ch1 twice ^ skip next single_crochet and double_crochet bpsc in next 3 double_crochet * repeat from * to * 2 times and from ^ to ^ once slip_stitch to fi rst bpsc to join and fasten_off 20 treble_crochet 8 v stitches 36 bpsc 32 ch1 space a very special thank you to the ladies who took a chance on a fi rst time pattern designer and tested this out for me jan bowman white elizabeth inda and cathy eichperger look for more designs by polly at everytrickonthehook com keep up to date with new designs patterns and coupon codes by following every trick on the hook on facebook copyright 2016 polly plum please do not redistribute with or without charge in any form this includes scanning emailing photocopying retyping posting to the internet and any other form of redistribution permission is granted to sell items made using this design but please include my name listed as the designer on a tag or label do
